report audit non-conformance

Store and reset
func:
/**
 * @typedef Answer
 * @property { Number } index - Question index
 * @property { String } section - Section Title
 * @property { String } question - Question
 * @property { Number } answer - Answer
*/

let results = global.get('fives.results', 'persistent') || []
let location = global.get('fives.currentLocation');

const sections = RED.util.cloneMessage(msg.sections)
const questionsRemaining = msg.questionsRemaining
const questionsAnswered = msg.questionsAnswered

/** @type {Answer[]} */
const currentQuiz = msg.currentQuiz

let totalScore = 0;
let totalQuestions = questionsAnswered + questionsRemaining;
const result = {
  datetime: Date.now(),
  inspector: msg.currentInspector,
  location,
  questionsRemaining, 
  questionsAnswered,
  totalQuestions,
  totalScore: msg.currentScore,
  score: msg.currentScore / totalQuestions,
  sections,
  complete: msg.done,
}

results.push(result)
global.set('fives.results', results, 'persistent')

// reset currentQuiz and currentIndex
global.set('fives.currentIndex', 0)
global.set('fives.currentQuiz', undefined)
global.set('fives.currentSection', undefined)
global.set('fives.currentQuestion', undefined)

return msg;

name: location audit details
Average score for area
Prep leader table
handleActions
Prepare avg scors data
Format Action Details Table Data
Showing last audit details
info:
Here we display the average score of the last audit, including details such as date and time, the average score presented as a percentage, 
and the total number of audits performed and count of open followups

name: Displaying audit details
info:
- Here, we display the average score of the month for 5s question groups.
- Additionally, we display the average score of the month for specific areas. Users have the ability to choose an area by selecting an option from the dropdown menu.
- Users can view the number of pending and closed events. They can also view and close details by navigating to the event details page, accessed by clicking the "Action Details" button.
- Moreover, users can observe the average percentage of the month for both areas on the leaderboard.

name: Performing audit
info:
Here, we have three buttons: 'Previous', 'Create follow-up', and 'Next', along with a section where we display questions and images based on the 'currentIndex' variable. 
We utilize an array of objects containing questions and image URLs. The display adjusts according to the 'currentIndex' variable. When the 'Next' button is clicked, 
the 'currentIndex' increases; however, when 'Previous' is clicked, 'currentIndex' decreases. When 'currentIndex' reaches 25, the user will navigate to the home page. 
This logic governs how the display behaves.

Additionally, there's a 'Create follow-up' button that allows logging events for specific questions.

We also have two steppers:

One for displaying the current question, based on the 'count' variable.
Another for the current question group, operating on the 'currentStep' variable

name: README
info:
# 5S Checklist

The 5S Checklist app makes it quick and easy to capture and analyze 5S audit data for reporting. End users are guided through 25 checks that can be configured to meet your operational needs. 
This leans app allows you to store data automatically and view it in an included dashboard.

## Accessing the Dashboard

To access the dashboard:
1. Click on the Node-RED sidebar drop down
2. Select "Dashboard 2.0"
2. Click "Open Dashboard"
3. The Dashboard will launch in a new pop-up window.

For further details about the Dashboard, visit: [FlowFuse Dashboard](https://dashboard.flowfuse.com/)

## Flow Structure

The flow's structure mirrors that of the dashboard. In the Node-RED Editor, 
each group corresponds to a page or dialog on the Node-RED Dashboard. 
Every group comes with a headline that is prominently displayed on the Dashboard itself.

## Data Integration: Simulation vs. Live Data

Before integrating the Dashboard into your environment:
1. Familiarize yourself with the provided data simulation.
2. Modify the flows to connect to your live data sources. Before making any changes, it's crucial to:
   - **Create a Snapshot**: This step ensures that you have a backup to revert to. 
   If any issues arise while adjusting the flows, you can effortlessly revert to a previous state.

For comprehensive details on utilizing Snapshots, 
refer to: [FlowFuse Snapshots Documentation](https://flowfuse.com/docs/user/snapshots/).

name: Display and close events
info:
Here, we display all follow-up action events in a table where users can view details such as the location where the audit was performed, 
the related question, the question group, a description of the event, and its status (indicating whether the action is closed or open).
Additionally, can click an entry in the table to mark it as closed.

name: Creating follow-up action
info:
Here, users can create a follow-up action. On the left side, they can view details 
for which they want to create a follow-up action. On the right side, users can enter 
a description for that specific follow-up action. After clicking on 'Log Event', 
the data will be stored in the global context.
